ingredients: 2   tablespoons    oil,3/4  cup    skim milk, plus 2 tablespoons skim milk warmed to 110 degrees ,1   teaspoon    sugar,2 1/3  cups    all-purpose flour,2 1/4  teaspoons    fast rising yeast,1/2  teaspoon    table salt,1 (8   ounce) can   hunts tomato sauce (with basil, garlic and oregano)
recipe: assemble all ingredients place in bread machine or mixer to form dough.,remove and divide in half for two 8 in deep dish pizzas or one 16 in pizza.,heavily oil two 8 in cake pans to make two 8 in pizzas.,place in preheated oven of 175 degrees once at this temperature turn oven off place pizzas in the oven for a short rise about 10 -15 min.,layer peperoni on paper towels and microwave approximately 1 min 10 seconds depending on your microwave to help remove excess grease.,add sauce and cheese and any toppings you want then place pizzas in oven and heat oven to 400 degrees as the temperature rises this will give the pizza dough oven spring and allow the dough to rise creating the deep dish pizza like pizza hut.,cook pizza at 400 degrees for approximately 20 to 30 minuets or until.,done then slice and eat. have fun and enjoy.
description: make and share this deep dish pizza (like pizza hut) recipe from food.com.
filtering: 2 tablespoon oil,3/4 cup skim milk , plus 2 tablespoon skim milk warmed to 110 degree ,1 teaspoon sugar,2 1/3 cup all-purpose flour,2 1/4 teaspoon fast rising yeast,1/2 teaspoon table salt,1 ( 8 ounce ) can hunt tomato sauce ( with basil , garlic and oregano ) make and share this deep dish pizza ( like pizza hut ) recipe from food.com . healthy hour assemble all ingredient place in bread machine or mixer to form dough. , remove and divide in half for two 8 in deep dish pizza or one 16 in pizza. , heavily oil two 8 in cake pan to make two 8 in pizzas. , place in preheated oven of 175 degree once at this temperature turn oven off place pizza in the oven for a short rise about 10 -15 min. , layer peperoni on paper towel and microwave approximately 1 min 10 second depending on your microwave to help remove excess grease. , add sauce and cheese and any topping you want then place pizza in oven and heat oven to 400 degree a the temperature rise this will give the pizza dough oven spring and allow the dough to rise creating the deep dish pizza like pizza hut. , cook pizza at 400 degree for approximately 20 to 30 minuet or until. , done then slice and eat . have fun and enjoy .

ingredients: 1   tablespoon    vegetable oil (additional 1 tbsp for softer crust),1 1/2  cups    warm water,2   tablespoons    brown sugar (packed),1   tablespoon    honey,3 1/2  cups    bread flour,1   teaspoon    salt,1   teaspoon    garlic powder (optional but recommended),1   teaspoon    oregano (optional but recommended),2 1/4  teaspoons    yeast (1 pkg)
recipe: preheat oven and pizza stone to 450f.,place ingredients in bread machine in the order listed, making a small pocket in center of flour mixture for the yeast.,select dough cycle.*.,let dough rise for at least 20 minutes. pound down and divide into two balls.,roll out or hand form crust. (see note).,form the pizza dough in two standard 16 inch pizza pans sprayed lightly with cooking spray.,perforate center of crust with a fork in multiple areas to prevent bubbles.,let dough set for another 10 minutes.,spread pizza sauce on dough 1/2 inch from edges. brush butter or olive oil on exposed edges.,pre-bake while still in pizza pan 6 minutes at 450f (pop any dough bubbles that may occur).,remove from oven. remove crust from pizza pan with metal spatula and place on pizza peel.(the peel isn’t necessary but makes it easier to slide the pizza onto the stone in the oven).,finish dressing pizza as desired and place pizza crust directly on pizza stone and bake for additional 8-12 minutes, depending on how dark you want your crust.,let pizza cool for a few minutes before slicing.,*while mixing, scrape sides of bread machine pan with plastic spatula to ensure complete mixing and add additional flour as needed to barely remove stickiness from the dough ball. sides of mixing pan should appear clean with smooth dough ball in center when desired dough consistency is achieved.,note:  to achieve the desired crust firmness i have a two-step process which produces a picture perfect pizza that still has all the benefits of pizza stone baking. it also makes dressing and handling of the pizza much easier.
keywords: healthy bread machine small appliance hours
description: this is by far the best pizza crust we have come up with, after tweaking and modifying several we has liked but weren't completely satisfied with.  this crust came out firm but not brittle and browned nicely on the top and bottom.
filtering: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil ( additional 1 tbsp for softer crust ) ,1 1/2 cup warm water,2 tablespoon brown sugar ( packed ) ,1 tablespoon honey,3 1/2 cup bread flour,1 teaspoon salt,1 teaspoon garlic powder ( optional but recommended ) ,1 teaspoon oregano ( optional but recommended ) ,2 1/4 teaspoon yeast ( 1 pkg ) this is by far the best pizza crust we have come up with , after tweaking and modifying several we ha liked but were n't completely satisfied with . this crust came out firm but not brittle and browned nicely on the top and bottom . healthy bread machine small appliance hour preheat oven and pizza stone to 450f. , place ingredient in bread machine in the order listed , making a small pocket in center of flour mixture for the yeast. , select dough cycle . *. , let dough rise for at least 20 minute . pound down and divide into two balls. , roll out or hand form crust . ( see note ) . , form the pizza dough in two standard 16 inch pizza pan sprayed lightly with cooking spray. , perforate center of crust with a fork in multiple area to prevent bubbles. , let dough set for another 10 minutes. , spread pizza sauce on dough 1/2 inch from edge . brush butter or olive oil on exposed edges. , pre-bake while still in pizza pan 6 minute at 450f ( pop any dough bubble that may occur ) . , remove from oven . remove crust from pizza pan with metal spatula and place on pizza peel . ( the peel isn & rsquo ; t necessary but make it easier to slide the pizza onto the stone in the oven ) . , finish dressing pizza a desired and place pizza crust directly on pizza stone and bake for additional 8-12 minute , depending on how dark you want your crust. , let pizza cool for a few minute before slicing. , *while mixing , scrape side of bread machine pan with plastic spatula to ensure complete mixing and add additional flour a needed to barely remove stickiness from the dough ball . side of mixing pan should appear clean with smooth dough ball in center when desired dough consistency is achieved. , note : to achieve the desired crust firmness i have a two-step process which produce a picture perfect pizza that still ha all the benefit of pizza stone baking . it also make dressing and handling of the pizza much easier .

ingredients: 2 1/4  teaspoons    dry yeast,1   cup    warm water,1   tablespoon    sugar,1   teaspoon    salt,2   tablespoons    olive oil,3   cups    bread flour
recipe: mix the water with the sugar and yeast. let stand for 5 minutes until dissolved and the yeast starts to bubble.,add the salt, olive oil and 1 cup of the flour and mix well.,add 2 more cups of flour, dough should be still a little sticky but should be able to form a ball.,turn out onto floured surface and start to knead, adding a little bit of flour as needed, until your dough is smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes.,form a fall, place into an oiled bowl and cover with a cloth napkin. let dough rise for 45 minutes. punch down and divide in half.,preheat oven to 400°f if using a pizza stone, be sure to put the stone in the oven while it heats up.,if using a baking pizza pan, lightly oil your baking pizza pan. otherwise, shape pizza on a lightly floured surface. with your hands, press on the dough to spread it out to about 1/2 cm high (very thin). top pizza with toppings of your choice. allow to rest for 10-15 minutes. if using a pizza stone, transfer to pizza stone.,drizzle olive oil over the top of the pizza before placing into the oven and bake for 18-22 minutes if using a pizza pan, 8-5 minutes if using a pizza stone, or until the cheese has melted and the crust is golden.
filtering: 2 1/4 teaspoon dry yeast,1 cup warm water,1 tablespoon sugar,1 teaspoon salt,2 tablespoon olive oil,3 cup bread flour from & quot ; tuscan recipe & quot ; - http : //www.tuscanrecipes.com/recipes/florentine-pizza-margerita.html low cholesterol healthy hour mix the water with the sugar and yeast . let stand for 5 minute until dissolved and the yeast start to bubble. , add the salt , olive oil and 1 cup of the flour and mix well. , add 2 more cup of flour , dough should be still a little sticky but should be able to form a ball. , turn out onto floured surface and start to knead , adding a little bit of flour a needed , until your dough is smooth and elastic , about 10 minutes. , form a fall , place into an oiled bowl and cover with a cloth napkin . let dough rise for 45 minute . punch down and divide in half. , preheat oven to 400 & deg ; f if using a pizza stone , be sure to put the stone in the oven while it heat up. , if using a baking pizza pan , lightly oil your baking pizza pan . otherwise , shape pizza on a lightly floured surface . with your hand , press on the dough to spread it out to about 1/2 cm high ( very thin ) . top pizza with topping of your choice . allow to rest for 10-15 minute . if using a pizza stone , transfer to pizza stone. , drizzle olive oil over the top of the pizza before placing into the oven and bake for 18-22 minute if using a pizza pan , 8-5 minute if using a pizza stone , or until the cheese ha melted and the crust is golden .

ingredients: refrigerated pizza dough,  tomato sauce,  fresh basil, mini pepperoni, bocconcini mozzarella cheese,  pesto sauce,  gouda cheese,  prosciutto,5   slices    baguette,  olive oil,  salt & pepper,  cheese,  meat,  fig jam
recipe: to make the pizza boxes:.,dust your counter with flour and roll out the pizza dough. using a 3-1/4 inch round cookie cutter, punch out 6 dough rounds. bake in pre-heated oven per package instructions.,once the pizza rounds have cooled, place 3 in your pepperoni pizza box and 3 in your pesto pizza box.,to make the pepperoni pizza box, arrange tomato sauce, fresh basil, mini pepperoni and bocconcini mozzarella.,to make the pesto pizza box, arrange pesto sauce, gouda and prosciutto.,build pizzas and enjoy.,to make the meat & cheese box:.,arrange the slices of baguette on a quarter sheet pan lined with parchment paper. drizzle olive oil over the baguette slices, then sprinkle with salt and pepper. broil them until golden brown to make crostini.,slice cheese into bite-sized slices.,to compose the box, add the crostini, the cheese slices, meats and fig jam.,try different combinations and enjoy.
description: you can still be the coolest kid in the lunch room by prepping some build-your-own lunchables. with everything already measured out in zip top bags, everybody will be talking about how epic your pizza game is.
filtering: refrigerated pizza dough , tomato sauce , fresh basil , mini pepperoni , bocconcini mozzarella cheese , pesto sauce , gouda cheese , prosciutto,5 slice baguette , olive oil , salt & pepper , cheese , meat , fig jam you can still be the coolest kid in the lunch room by prepping some build-your-own lunchables . with everything already measured out in zip top bag , everybody will be talking about how epic your pizza game is . low cholesterol healthy min to make the pizza box : . , dust your counter with flour and roll out the pizza dough . using a 3-1/4 inch round cookie cutter , punch out 6 dough round . bake in pre-heated oven per package instructions. , once the pizza round have cooled , place 3 in your pepperoni pizza box and 3 in your pesto pizza box. , to make the pepperoni pizza box , arrange tomato sauce , fresh basil , mini pepperoni and bocconcini mozzarella. , to make the pesto pizza box , arrange pesto sauce , gouda and prosciutto. , build pizza and enjoy. , to make the meat & amp ; cheese box : . , arrange the slice of baguette on a quarter sheet pan lined with parchment paper . drizzle olive oil over the baguette slice , then sprinkle with salt and pepper . broil them until golden brown to make crostini. , slice cheese into bite-sized slices. , to compose the box , add the crostini , the cheese slice , meat and fig jam. , try different combination and enjoy .

ingredients: olive oil flavored cooking spray,  garlic powder,2       whole wheat tortillas,8 -10   tablespoons    pizza sauce,4 -6   tablespoons    mozzarella cheese (shredded)
recipe: heat the oven to 450 degrees.,spray each tortilla lightly with the olive oil spray, and then flip them over, so that the oiled side is facing down.,lightly sprinkle the top of the tortillas with garlic powder.,cut each tortilla in half (this will allow you to fit both tortillas on the pizza stone) and arrange on a pizza stone.,evenly divide the tomato sauce over the tortillas. sprinkle with the cheese.,add any additional toppings you desire, and put the pizza stone into the oven. watch carefully to ensure the pizza doesn't burn. (in my convection oven, the pizza was done after a mere 5 minutes).
keywords: healthy kid friendly high in mins oven beginner cook easy inexpensive
description:
this is super simple way to make mini pizzas. the olive oil spray will prevent the pizzas from being soggy in the middle--yay!

feel free to add whatever additional toppings you have on hand. we especially like to add caramelized onions.
filtering: olive oil flavored cooking spray , garlic powder,2 whole wheat tortillas,8 -10 tablespoon pizza sauce,4 -6 tablespoon mozzarella cheese ( shredded ) this is super simple way to make mini pizza . the olive oil spray will prevent the pizza from being soggy in the middle -- yay ! feel free to add whatever additional topping you have on hand . we especially like to add caramelized onion . healthy kid friendly high in min oven beginner cook easy inexpensive heat the oven to 450 degrees. , spray each tortilla lightly with the olive oil spray , and then flip them over , so that the oiled side is facing down. , lightly sprinkle the top of the tortilla with garlic powder. , cut each tortilla in half ( this will allow you to fit both tortilla on the pizza stone ) and arrange on a pizza stone. , evenly divide the tomato sauce over the tortilla . sprinkle with the cheese. , add any additional topping you desire , and put the pizza stone into the oven . watch carefully to ensure the pizza doe n't burn . ( in my convection oven , the pizza wa done after a mere 5 minute ) .

ingredients: 1 1/2  cups    all-purpose flour,3/8  teaspoon    salt,2 1/4  teaspoons    baking powder,1   cup   nonfat plain greek strained yogurt
recipe: preheat oven to 425.  mix 1 1/4 cups of flour (reserve a quarter cup), salt, baking powder, and yogurt together.,use knead attachment on mixing bowl and mix for 5 minutes.  dough will still be very very sticky.  add in remaining 1/4 cup flour.  mix on very low speed until dough for a few seconds just comes together.  do not knead again because the dough will become sticky again.,put whatever toppings you wish on pizza.  sprinkle cornmeal onto pizza stone.  place one of the pizzas onto the pizza stone and bake about 10 minutes until dough rises, bubbles up and turns a golden brown.  bake only pizzas one at a time.  eat immediately.
keywords: low cholesterol healthy high in mins easy
description: it really is the easiest crust i've ever made.  no yeast, no waiting for it to rise, no wishing it would hurry up.  you don't need to go to pizza crust cooking school or even the store to make pizza.  save some extra flour and extra cornmeal for dusting.  recipe courtesy of kirbie's cravings.
filtering: 1 1/2 cup all-purpose flour,3/8 teaspoon salt,2 1/4 teaspoon baking powder,1 cup nonfat plain greek strained yogurt it really is the easiest crust i 've ever made . no yeast , no waiting for it to rise , no wishing it would hurry up . you do n't need to go to pizza crust cooking school or even the store to make pizza . save some extra flour and extra cornmeal for dusting . recipe courtesy of kirbie 's craving . low cholesterol healthy high in min easy preheat oven to 425. mix 1 1/4 cup of flour ( reserve a quarter cup ) , salt , baking powder , and yogurt together. , use knead attachment on mixing bowl and mix for 5 minute . dough will still be very very sticky . add in remaining 1/4 cup flour . mix on very low speed until dough for a few second just come together . do not knead again because the dough will become sticky again. , put whatever topping you wish on pizza . sprinkle cornmeal onto pizza stone . place one of the pizza onto the pizza stone and bake about 10 minute until dough rise , bubble up and turn a golden brown . bake only pizza one at a time . eat immediately .

ingredients: 4 1/2  cups    bread flour,1 1/2  teaspoons    sugar,1 1/2  teaspoons    salt,2 1/4  teaspoons    instant yeast,3   tablespoons    olive oil,1 3/4  cups    warm water (approx. 105 degrees)
recipe: combine all of the dry ingredients in a bowl. and whisk to blend.  add the remaking ingredients to the bowl, and using a dough hook, blend the dough until everything is incorporated.  knead the dough with the hook for 5 minutes.,grease a large bowl.  shape the dough into a ball and place in the greased bowl. grease the dough, cover with plastic then place in the fridge  overnight.  at this point, you can freeze it, well wrapped, if you like.,remove from the refrigerator and divide the dough into 2 or 3 parts, depending on whether you want thin or thick crust pizzas. shape into balls and let rest for about 2 hours before baking.,shape the pizzas using your hands and place on parchment paper, then on the pizza pan.  add your preferred pizza sauce and top with desired toppings.,preheat the oven to 500&deg;f if using a pizza stone, place it in the oven prior to heating the oven.,using the pizza pan, slide just the pizza and the parchment paper, onto the hot stone.  bake for approximately 7 minutes, or until desired colour is reached.,to remove from the oven, slide the cooked pizza using the parchment paper, back onto the pizza pan. let cool several minutes before slicing. enjoy.
description: the dough forms a nice crust that is both crunchy & chewy...delicious. i make 2 large thick crust pizzas.
filtering: 4 1/2 cup bread flour,1 1/2 teaspoon sugar,1 1/2 teaspoon salt,2 1/4 teaspoon instant yeast,3 tablespoon olive oil,1 3/4 cup warm water ( approx . 105 degree ) the dough form a nice crust that is both crunchy & amp ; chewy ... delicious . i make 2 large thick crust pizza . healthy min combine all of the dry ingredient in a bowl . and whisk to blend . & nbsp ; add the remaking ingredient to the bowl , and using a dough hook , blend the dough until everything is incorporated . & nbsp ; knead the dough with the hook for 5 minutes. , grease a large bowl . & nbsp ; shape the dough into a ball and place in the greased bowl . grease the dough , cover with plastic then place in the fridge & nbsp ; overnight . & nbsp ; at this point , you can freeze it , well wrapped , if you like. , remove from the refrigerator and divide the dough into 2 or 3 part , depending on whether you want thin or thick crust pizza . shape into ball and let rest for about 2 hour before baking. , shape the pizza using your hand and place on parchment paper , then on the pizza pan . & nbsp ; add your preferred pizza sauce and top with desired toppings. , preheat the oven to 500 & amp ; deg ; f if using a pizza stone , place it in the oven prior to heating the oven. , using the pizza pan , slide just the pizza and the parchment paper , onto the hot stone . & nbsp ; bake for approximately 7 minute , or until desired colour is reached. , to remove from the oven , slide the cooked pizza using the parchment paper , back onto the pizza pan . let cool several minute before slicing . enjoy .

ingredients: 1   small    red bell pepper, chopped ,1   small    green bell pepper, chopped ,1   small    yellow bell pepper, chopped ,1   small    red onion, chopped ,2   tablespoons    virgin olive oil,1 -2       garlic clove, minced ,1   tablespoon    italian seasoning,8   ounces   of crumbled feta cheese,1       whole wheat pizza crust,1       chicken breast (optional)
recipe: preheat oven to 350.  place pizza crust on pizza pan. chop red onion and all 3 peppers and place in  bowl. combine olive oil, garlic, and italian seasoning so all the peppers and onions are coated.  pour over pizza crust and sprinkle with feta cheese.  bake for approx 10-15 min or until cheese has started to brown.  if you wish to add chicken, grill beforehand and chop.  mix in with vegetables and spread over pizza crust, add feta on top.
description: during my undergraduate training i needed to take a nutrition class.  as part of our final we had to create the best balanced entre we could come up with. we incorporated good fats,  vegetables, dairy, whole wheat and protein (optional) to make a very simple, tasty dish.  everyone in class loved it and we got an a, so hopefully you will enjoy too!  be careful when assembling pizza though, with too much pepper and onion, the vegetables won't cook evenly and you end up with a mess (but it's still yummy!)
filtering: 1 small red bell pepper , chopped ,1 small green bell pepper , chopped ,1 small yellow bell pepper , chopped ,1 small red onion , chopped ,2 tablespoon virgin olive oil,1 -2 garlic clove , minced ,1 tablespoon italian seasoning,8 ounce of crumbled feta cheese,1 whole wheat pizza crust,1 chicken breast ( optional ) during my undergraduate training i needed to take a nutrition class . a part of our final we had to create the best balanced entre we could come up with . we incorporated good fat , vegetable , dairy , whole wheat and protein ( optional ) to make a very simple , tasty dish . everyone in class loved it and we got an a , so hopefully you will enjoy too ! be careful when assembling pizza though , with too much pepper and onion , the vegetable wo n't cook evenly and you end up with a mess ( but it 's still yummy ! ) vegetable min beginner cook easy preheat oven to 350. place pizza crust on pizza pan . chop red onion and all 3 pepper and place in bowl . combine olive oil , garlic , and italian seasoning so all the pepper and onion are coated . pour over pizza crust and sprinkle with feta cheese . bake for approx 10-15 min or until cheese ha started to brown . if you wish to add chicken , grill beforehand and chop . mix in with vegetable and spread over pizza crust , add feta on top .

ingredients: 1   teaspoon    active dry yeast,2   cups    bread flour,1/4  teaspoon    salt,1/2  cup   lukewarm water,1/2  teaspoon    cayenne pepper (optional),1/4  cup   pureed black beans (if use canned beans, rinse and drain first)
recipe: combine and knead all ingredients (i used my bread machine).,let rise 50-60 minutes.,roll dough on a cornmeal-covered counter.,place dough in pizza pan.,for a thin, crispy crust, place toppings on dough and bake immediately.,for a thicker, chewier crust, allow dough to rise 15-30 minutes before adding toppings.,place pizza on the bottom rack of oven (preheated to 500°f) 5-10 minutes.,we filled our pizzas with pizza sauce, rest of the black beans, tomatoes, zucchini, onions.

description: make and share this black-bean-pizza-dough recipe recipe from food.com.
filtering: 1 teaspoon active dry yeast,2 cup bread flour,1/4 teaspoon salt,1/2 cup lukewarm water,1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper ( optional ) ,1/4 cup pureed black bean ( if use canned bean , rinse and drain first ) make and share this black-bean-pizza-dough recipe recipe from food.com . bread lunch snack black bean bean vegetable vegan low cholesterol healthy weeknight oven hour easy combine and knead all ingredient ( i used my bread machine ) . , let rise 50-60 minutes. , roll dough on a cornmeal-covered counter. , place dough in pizza pan. , for a thin , crispy crust , place topping on dough and bake immediately. , for a thicker , chewier crust , allow dough to rise 15-30 minute before adding toppings. , place pizza on the bottom rack of oven ( preheated to 500 & deg ; f ) 5-10 minutes. , we filled our pizza with pizza sauce , rest of the black bean , tomato , zucchini , onion .

ingredients: 1   large    onion, chopped ,2       garlic cloves, minced ,3   tablespoons    olive oil,1 (28   ounce) can   whole tomatoes,1 (28   ounce) can   crushed tomatoes,1 (12   ounce) can   tomato paste,1   teaspoon    salt,3 -5   dashes    ground pepper, to taste ,2   teaspoons    dried oregano,2   teaspoons    dried basil,1       bay leaf,1/4  cup    parsley, chopped
recipe: brown onion and garlic in oil until soft and golden.,add remaining ingredients and heat to boiling over medium heat.,reduce and simmer uncovered for approximately two hours, stirring occasionally, until sauce has thickened (and mushing up the tomatoes a bit with your spoon when you stir).,discard bay leaf.,makes enough sauce for 5-6 pizzas.,to use for pizza:either follow directions on your favorite pizza recipe or spread desired amount of sauce on pizza dough, top with cheese and any other toppings as desired, then bake in a preheated 425 f oven for about 15-20 minutes.
keywords: vegetable european low protein low cholesterol healthy savory hours
description: found this recipe tucked in one of my mom's cookbooks. jane was a neighbor when i was growing up. she was an amazing cook. mom would buy pizza dough from the local pizzeria to make pizza at home. this makes enough sauce for about 5-6 large pizzas. it will be very thick and slightly chunky. freeze in small batches for up to 3 months.
filtering: 1 large onion , chopped ,2 garlic clove , minced ,3 tablespoon olive oil,1 ( 28 ounce ) can whole tomatoes,1 ( 28 ounce ) can crushed tomatoes,1 ( 12 ounce ) can tomato paste,1 teaspoon salt,3 -5 dash ground pepper , to taste ,2 teaspoon dried oregano,2 teaspoon dried basil,1 bay leaf,1/4 cup parsley , chopped found this recipe tucked in one of my mom 's cookbook . jane wa a neighbor when i wa growing up . she wa an amazing cook . mom would buy pizza dough from the local pizzeria to make pizza at home . this make enough sauce for about 5-6 large pizza . it will be very thick and slightly chunky . freeze in small batch for up to 3 month . vegetable european low protein low cholesterol healthy savory hour brown onion and garlic in oil until soft and golden. , add remaining ingredient and heat to boiling over medium heat. , reduce and simmer uncovered for approximately two hour , stirring occasionally , until sauce ha thickened ( and mushing up the tomato a bit with your spoon when you stir ) . , discard bay leaf. , make enough sauce for 5-6 pizzas. , to use for pizza : either follow direction on your favorite pizza recipe or spread desired amount of sauce on pizza dough , top with cheese and any other topping a desired , then bake in a preheated 425 f oven for about 15-20 minute .

ingredients: 2 3/4  cups    bread flour,1   tablespoon    active dry yeast,2   teaspoons    salt
recipe: combine all ingredients. place in an airtight jar.,attach these instructions on a gift tag.,pizza:  (makes two 12" pizzas).,contents of pizza dough mix jar.,2 tbls olive oil.,1 cup warm water.,1 cup tomato sauce.,1/2 cup grated mozzarella cheese.,1/3 cup freshly grated parmesan.,1 tsp crushed oregano.,place the pizza dough mix in a large bowl and add the olive oil and water.,beat with a wooden spoon or dough hook until mixture forms a ball.,turn out onto a floured surface and knead for 5 minutes.,transfer to a greased bowl, turn up so that top is greased. cover and let the dough rise for 90 minutes.,divide the dough in half and pat into 2 12" circles.  for thin crust, fill and bake the pizzas now.  for thicker crust, let rise 30-45 minutes.,top the pizza with tomato sauce, cheeses of your choise and crushed oregano.,drizzle olive oil over the pizzas.,preheat oven to 425* -- and bake for 20-25 minutes. let stand 5 minutes before serving.
description:
this mix makes enough for 2  12" pizzas..be sure to indicate this on gift card.
or make and keep on hand for your self..
filtering: 2 3/4 cup bread flour,1 tablespoon active dry yeast,2 teaspoon salt this mix make enough for 2 12 & quot ; pizzas..be sure to indicate this on gift card . or make and keep on hand for your self.. healthy hour easy combine all ingredient . place in an airtight jar . , attach these instruction on a gift tag . , pizza : ( make two 12 & quot ; pizza ) . , content of pizza dough mix jar . ,2 tbls olive oil . ,1 cup warm water . ,1 cup tomato sauce . ,1/2 cup grated mozzarella cheese . ,1/3 cup freshly grated parmesan . ,1 tsp crushed oregano . , place the pizza dough mix in a large bowl and add the olive oil and water . , beat with a wooden spoon or dough hook until mixture form a ball . , turn out onto a floured surface and knead for 5 minute . , transfer to a greased bowl , turn up so that top is greased . cover and let the dough rise for 90 minute . , divide the dough in half and pat into 2 12 & quot ; circle . for thin crust , fill and bake the pizza now . for thicker crust , let rise 30-45 minute . , top the pizza with tomato sauce , cheese of your choise and crushed oregano . , drizzle olive oil over the pizza . , preheat oven to 425* -- and bake for 20-25 minute . let stand 5 minute before serving .

ingredients: 1       6 inch fat-free whole wheat pita bread,1/3  cup    tomato sauce,3   ounces    lowfat mozzarella cheese,1/2  cup    broccoli (steamed),2       garlic cloves (or jarred garlic like christopher ranch),1   teaspoon    olive oil,1   tablespoon    black olives (chopped)
recipe: pre heat pizza stone in a 400 degrees oven.,sauté garlic and broccoli.,carefully cut a pocket into the center of the pita, but be careful not to slice through, then stuff inside with the sautéed steamed broccoli and garlic.,spread tomato sauce on top of the pita.,sprinkle black olive and mozzarella on top and place in the oven on the pizza stone. (regular pizza pan or piece of aluminum foil can be used it you do not have a pizza stone).,bake for approximately 12 -15 minutes until cheese is melted and lightly browned.,remove from oven and cut into quarters and enjoy!
description: i donât know about you, but if i canât have pizza on my diet i feel as though i am being denied one of the basic four-food groups.  i have created this recipe as one of my lunch choices for a very strict 1800-calorie per day low fat cardiac diet.  i finish off with 1 cup of strawberries and water or a non-caloric beverage for a tasty, low calorie and more heart healthy lunch.
filtering: 1 6 inch fat-free whole wheat pita bread,1/3 cup tomato sauce,3 ounce lowfat mozzarella cheese,1/2 cup broccoli ( steamed ) ,2 garlic clove ( or jarred garlic like christopher ranch ) ,1 teaspoon olive oil,1 tablespoon black olive ( chopped ) i donât know about you , but if i canât have pizza on my diet i feel a though i am being denied one of the basic four-food group . i have created this recipe a one of my lunch choice for a very strict 1800-calorie per day low fat cardiac diet . i finish off with 1 cup of strawberry and water or a non-caloric beverage for a tasty , low calorie and more heart healthy lunch . european min pre heat pizza stone in a 400 degree oven. , saut & eacute ; garlic and broccoli. , carefully cut a pocket into the center of the pita , but be careful not to slice through , then stuff inside with the saut & eacute ; ed steamed broccoli and garlic. , spread tomato sauce on top of the pita. , sprinkle black olive and mozzarella on top and place in the oven on the pizza stone . ( regular pizza pan or piece of aluminum foil can be used it you do not have a pizza stone ) . , bake for approximately 12 -15 minute until cheese is melted and lightly browned. , remove from oven and cut into quarter and enjoy !

ingredients: 2   cups    all-purpose flour,1   tablespoon    baking powder,1/4  teaspoon    salt,2/3  cup    water,1   tablespoon    cooking oil,1   teaspoon    cooking oil,1/2  lb    boneless skinless chicken breast half (about 2),  salt, sprinkle ,  pepper, sprinkle ,1/2  cup   creamy light caesar salad dressing,3/4  cup   grated part-skim mozzarella cheese,2   cups   finely chopped romaine lettuce,1/4  cup   creamy light caesar salad dressing,3   tablespoons   grated parmesan cheese
recipe: for the biscuit pizza crust:  stir flour, baking powder and salt together in medium bowl.,add water and cooking oil.  stir to form soft ball.  knead on lightly floured surface 8 to 10 times.  roll out and press in greased 12 inch pizza pan, forming rim around edge.,note:  you can use this crust to make a thin biscuit pizza crust:  reduce flour to 1 1/2 cups.  reduce water to 1/2 cup.  crust will cook a bit quicker.,wheat biscuit pizza crust:  use whole wheat flour for half of all purpose flour called for.,for the topping:  prepare pizza dough.  roll out and press in greased 12 inch pizza pan, forming rim around edge.,place cooking oil and chicken in medium non stick frying pan.  sprinkle with salt and pepper.  saute for about 5 minutes until chicken is cooked.,spread first amount of caesar dressing over crust.  sprinkle mozzarella cheese over dressing.  scatter chicken over top.  bake on bottom rack in 425°f oven for 13 to 15 minutes, or for 8 minutes if using partially baked crust. take pizza out of oven and spoon on caesar salad.,toss lettuce with second amount of caesar dressing in large bowl.  spoon over top.  sprinkle with parmesan cheese.  serve hot.  cuts into 8 wedges.,companyâs coming pizza!
description: like a chicken caesar salad on bread.  more chicken may be added if desired.  the pizza crust is quicker to prepare than a yeast crust.
filtering: 2 cup all-purpose flour,1 tablespoon baking powder,1/4 teaspoon salt,2/3 cup water,1 tablespoon cooking oil,1 teaspoon cooking oil,1/2 lb boneless skinless chicken breast half ( about 2 ) , salt , sprinkle , pepper , sprinkle ,1/2 cup creamy light caesar salad dressing,3/4 cup grated part-skim mozzarella cheese,2 cup finely chopped romaine lettuce,1/4 cup creamy light caesar salad dressing,3 tablespoon grated parmesan cheese like a chicken caesar salad on bread . more chicken may be added if desired . the pizza crust is quicker to prepare than a yeast crust . bread healthy high in min for the biscuit pizza crust : stir flour , baking powder and salt together in medium bowl. , add water and cooking oil . stir to form soft ball . knead on lightly floured surface 8 to 10 time . roll out and press in greased 12 inch pizza pan , forming rim around edge. , note : you can use this crust to make a thin biscuit pizza crust : reduce flour to 1 1/2 cup . reduce water to 1/2 cup . crust will cook a bit quicker. , wheat biscuit pizza crust : use whole wheat flour for half of all purpose flour called for. , for the topping : prepare pizza dough . roll out and press in greased 12 inch pizza pan , forming rim around edge. , place cooking oil and chicken in medium non stick frying pan . sprinkle with salt and pepper . saute for about 5 minute until chicken is cooked. , spread first amount of caesar dressing over crust . sprinkle mozzarella cheese over dressing . scatter chicken over top . bake on bottom rack in 425 & deg ; f oven for 13 to 15 minute , or for 8 minute if using partially baked crust . take pizza out of oven and spoon on caesar salad. , toss lettuce with second amount of caesar dressing in large bowl . spoon over top . sprinkle with parmesan cheese . serve hot . cut into 8 wedges. , companyâs coming pizza !

ingredients: 2 1/3  cups    water,1   cup    yellow cornmeal,1   tablespoon    butter,1/4  teaspoon    salt,1/8  teaspoon    ground red pepper
recipe: heat oven to 425.  grease 12 inch pizza pan with shortening.,heat water to boiling in 2-quart saucepan.,stir in remaining ingredients with wire whisk until mixture is smooth and thickens.,spoon onto pizza pan and spread evenly, mounding edge slightly.,bake 5 to 7 minutes or until set and light brown.,after you top pizza with your favorite toppings, bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and toppings are hot.
keywords: low protein low cholesterol healthy mins easy
description: i needed to make another pizza crust and didn't have time for the dough to rise.  this was super simple and quite good.  who knew?  recipe courtesy of betty crocker's new cookbook.
filtering: 2 1/3 cup water,1 cup yellow cornmeal,1 tablespoon butter,1/4 teaspoon salt,1/8 teaspoon ground red pepper i needed to make another pizza crust and did n't have time for the dough to rise . this wa super simple and quite good . who knew ? recipe courtesy of betty crocker 's new cookbook . low protein low cholesterol healthy min easy heat oven to 425. grease 12 inch pizza pan with shortening. , heat water to boiling in 2-quart saucepan. , stir in remaining ingredient with wire whisk until mixture is smooth and thickens. , spoon onto pizza pan and spread evenly , mounding edge slightly. , bake 5 to 7 minute or until set and light brown. , after you top pizza with your favorite topping , bake for 15 to 20 minute or until cheese is melted and topping are hot .

recipe_name: Quick & Easy (& HEALTHY) Mixed Seafood Pizza
ingredients: 1      whole-wheat pizza crust, 10-12 inches in diameter ,2   tablespoons    olive oil,1   cup    pizza sauce,1   lb   mixed cooked seafood (such as shrimp, mussels, & squid),3       garlic cloves, chopped ,2   tablespoons    fresh parsley, chopped ,2   tablespoons    parmesan cheese, shredded
recipe: preheat the oven to 425f.,lightly brush the top of the pizza crust with about 1 tablespoon of the olive oil.  then, spread the sauce over it, and bake for ten minutes.,pat the cooked seafood dry using paper towels, then arrange on top of the pizza.  then, sprinkle the chopped garlic and parsley on top of that.,drizzle the remaining oil over the pizza and return it to the oven.  bake for 5-10 minutes, until the seafood is warmed through and the crust is golden.,sprinkle with the cheese and serve immediately.
keywords: baking mins oven beginner cook easy
description: this a great recipe for those times when you want to eat something unique, but you don't want to spend a lot of time making it.  this calls for common store-bought ingredients, but you can easily tweak the recipe.  for example, sometimes i use 3 personal-size pizza crusts instead of one large pizza crust, and you can easily just use shrimp if you can't find the frozen seafood mix.
filtering: 1 whole-wheat pizza crust , 10-12 inch in diameter ,2 tablespoon olive oil,1 cup pizza sauce,1 lb mixed cooked seafood ( such a shrimp , mussel , & squid ) ,3 garlic clove , chopped ,2 tablespoon fresh parsley , chopped ,2 tablespoon parmesan cheese , shredded this a great recipe for those time when you want to eat something unique , but you do n't want to spend a lot of time making it . this call for common store-bought ingredient , but you can easily tweak the recipe . for example , sometimes i use 3 personal-size pizza crust instead of one large pizza crust , and you can easily just use shrimp if you ca n't find the frozen seafood mix . baking min oven beginner cook easy preheat the oven to 425f. , lightly brush the top of the pizza crust with about 1 tablespoon of the olive oil . then , spread the sauce over it , and bake for ten minutes. , pat the cooked seafood dry using paper towel , then arrange on top of the pizza . then , sprinkle the chopped garlic and parsley on top of that. , drizzle the remaining oil over the pizza and return it to the oven . bake for 5-10 minute , until the seafood is warmed through and the crust is golden. , sprinkle with the cheese and serve immediately .

ingredients: 3   cups   lukewarm water (100f or below),3   tablespoons   lukewarm water (100f or below),1/3  cup    olive oil,1   tablespoon    granulated yeast,1 1/2  tablespoons    kosher salt,7 1/2  cups    unbleached all-purpose flour
recipe: combine warm water (about 100f), olive oil, yeast and salt in a 5-quart bowl; preferably, in a lidded (not airtight) plastic container or food-grade bucket.,measure the flour using a "swoop and sweep" method.  reach into the flour bin with your measuring cup, scooping up a full measure all at once, and sweeping it level with a knife.,mix until all of the flour is incorproated (kneading is not necessary) using a wooden spoon or a food processor with a dough attachment.,cover with a non-airtight lid.,allow to rise at room temperature for 2 hours.,do not punch down!  you want to retain as much gas in the dough as possible.  a reduction in gas will make your pizzas and flatbreads dense.,refrigerate and use over the next 14 days.  refigerate at least 3 hours before using.,on pizza day.,30 minutes before you're ready to bake, place a pizza stone at the bottom third of the oven and preheat it at your oven's highest temperature.,prepare and organize your toppings.,dust a pizza peel (or a large cutting board/flat cookie sheet) with enough flour or cornmeal to easily tranfer the pizza over to the hot stone.,pull up and cut off a 1/2 pound (orange-size) piece of dough.,using a little flour (enough so it won't stick to your fingers), stretch and shape the dough into a ball.,sprinkle your work area with a little flour.  using your hands or a rolling pin, roll out and stretch the dough until it is approximately 1/8" thick and 12" wide.,place the finished dough onto the prepared pizza peel and add the toppings of your choice.,carefully slide the pizza onto the hot stone (if it isn't sliding, you will need to sprinkle more flour or cornmeal between the pizza and the pizza peel, until it moves.,check for doneness after 8-10 minutes - it may take a few minutes longer.  turn the pizza around if the one side is browning faster than the other.,allow to cool slightly on a wire rack.
keywords: breads low cholesterol healthy kid friendly mins easy
description: love, love this recipe!  so many great things to say about it: ridiculously easy to make, incredibly delicious, and it can be stored in your fridge for up to 2 weeks.  perfect for an afterschool snack or an easy dinner!  don't get overwhelmed by all of the instructions - you just have to read through them once - its basic pizza making.  from the book artisan pizza and flatbread in five minutes a day.
filtering: 3 cup lukewarm water ( 100f or below ) ,3 tablespoon lukewarm water ( 100f or below ) ,1/3 cup olive oil,1 tablespoon granulated yeast,1 1/2 tablespoon kosher salt,7 1/2 cup unbleached all-purpose flour love , love this recipe ! so many great thing to say about it : ridiculously easy to make , incredibly delicious , and it can be stored in your fridge for up to 2 week . perfect for an afterschool snack or an easy dinner ! do n't get overwhelmed by all of the instruction - you just have to read through them once - it basic pizza making . from the book artisan pizza and flatbread in five minute a day . bread low cholesterol healthy kid friendly min easy combine warm water ( about 100f ) , olive oil , yeast and salt in a 5-quart bowl ; preferably , in a lidded ( not airtight ) plastic container or food-grade bucket. , measure the flour using a & quot ; swoop and sweep & quot ; method . reach into the flour bin with your measuring cup , scooping up a full measure all at once , and sweeping it level with a knife. , mix until all of the flour is incorproated ( kneading is not necessary ) using a wooden spoon or a food processor with a dough attachment. , cover with a non-airtight lid. , allow to rise at room temperature for 2 hours. , do not punch down ! you want to retain a much gas in the dough a possible . a reduction in gas will make your pizza and flatbread dense. , refrigerate and use over the next 14 day . refigerate at least 3 hour before using. , on pizza day.,30 minute before you 're ready to bake , place a pizza stone at the bottom third of the oven and preheat it at your oven 's highest temperature. , prepare and organize your toppings. , dust a pizza peel ( or a large cutting board/flat cookie sheet ) with enough flour or cornmeal to easily tranfer the pizza over to the hot stone. , pull up and cut off a 1/2 pound ( orange-size ) piece of dough. , using a little flour ( enough so it wo n't stick to your finger ) , stretch and shape the dough into a ball. , sprinkle your work area with a little flour . using your hand or a rolling pin , roll out and stretch the dough until it is approximately 1/8 & quot ; thick and 12 & quot ; wide. , place the finished dough onto the prepared pizza peel and add the topping of your choice. , carefully slide the pizza onto the hot stone ( if it is n't sliding , you will need to sprinkle more flour or cornmeal between the pizza and the pizza peel , until it moves. , check for doneness after 8-10 minute - it may take a few minute longer . turn the pizza around if the one side is browning faster than the other. , allow to cool slightly on a wire rack .

ingredients: 1       portabella mushroom, cap ,1/4  cup   sliced bell pepper (green,yellow whatever you like),2   tablespoons    marinara sauce (i used pasta sauce),1   tablespoon    parmesan cheese, grated  (kraft-light is good),1/4  cup    onion, sliced
recipe: place the mushroom cap upside down on a cookie sheet. spread the marinara sauce over the mushroom, and top with the remaining ingredients - just like a normal pizza.,bake in the oven at 350°f until the cheese melts and the âpizzaâ?is warmed through.
keywords: vegetable low protein low cholesterol healthy mins beginner cook easy
description: i found this recipe while looking for low calorie meals.  i must say this was the best "pizza" i ever had!!  can be used as an appetizer or snack.  i use it in my low calorie diet as a dinner.
filtering: 1 portabella mushroom , cap ,1/4 cup sliced bell pepper ( green , yellow whatever you like ) ,2 tablespoon marinara sauce ( i used pasta sauce ) ,1 tablespoon parmesan cheese , grated ( kraft-light is good ) ,1/4 cup onion , sliced i found this recipe while looking for low calorie meal . i must say this wa the best & quot ; pizza & quot ; i ever had ! ! can be used a an appetizer or snack . i use it in my low calorie diet a a dinner . vegetable low protein low cholesterol healthy min beginner cook easy place the mushroom cap upside down on a cookie sheet . spread the marinara sauce over the mushroom , and top with the remaining ingredient - just like a normal pizza . , bake in the oven at 350 & deg ; f until the cheese melt and the âpizzaâ ? is warmed through .

ingredients: 1   package    dry yeast,1/8  cup    warm water,3/4  cup    all-purpose flour,3/4  cup   deffated soy flour,1/2  teaspoon    salt,  cornmeal,1/2  cup    pizza sauce,4   ounces   shredded fat free mozzarella cheese,  seasoning
recipe: combine yeast and water and let sit for 10 minutes.,pour the yeast mixture and salt in the flour and mix well.,put the flour in an oiled bowl and cover.,let it sit until double (1 hour).,put some cornmeal in a pizza pan and put the flour on the pan.,spread the pizza onto the pan.,let it sit for 20 minutes.,add pizza sauce, cheese, and toppings.,bake at 400 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until cheese is melted.,serve.
keywords: high protein healthy high in weeknight oven hours
description: make and share this healthy pizza recipe from food.com.
filtering: 1 package dry yeast,1/8 cup warm water,3/4 cup all-purpose flour,3/4 cup deffated soy flour,1/2 teaspoon salt , cornmeal,1/2 cup pizza sauce,4 ounce shredded fat free mozzarella cheese , seasoning make and share this healthy pizza recipe from food.com . high protein healthy high in weeknight oven hour combine yeast and water and let sit for 10 minutes. , pour the yeast mixture and salt in the flour and mix well. , put the flour in an oiled bowl and cover. , let it sit until double ( 1 hour ) . , put some cornmeal in a pizza pan and put the flour on the pan. , spread the pizza onto the pan. , let it sit for 20 minutes. , add pizza sauce , cheese , and toppings. , bake at 400 degree for 20-25 minute or until cheese is melted. , serve .

recipe_name: Pizza Base for the Bread Maker
ingredients: 1 1/2  cups    warm water,2   tablespoons    garlic-flavored olive oil,4   cups    flour,1 1/2  teaspoons    salt,1/3  cup    fresh parmesan cheese, finely grated ,1   teaspoon    dry oregano,1   teaspoon    dry basil,1   teaspoon    dried parsley,3   teaspoons    active dry yeast,1   teaspoon    sugar,1   tablespoon    powdered milk
recipe: measure all the ingredients into the pan of the bread maker - the order given will give the best results.,run the machine on the dough only cycle.,press down to deflate slightly and rest for 30 minutes and heat the oven up with a heavy flat tray or pizza stone on the lowest rack.,spread/stretch/roll out to fit your pizza pan.,top with your favorite toppings.,place into your hot oven, still in the pizza pan, on top of the hot tray and bake at 220c for 15-20 minutes.
keywords: healthy bread machine mins small appliance inexpensive
description: make and share this pizza base for the bread maker recipe from food.com.
filtering: 1 1/2 cup warm water,2 tablespoon garlic-flavored olive oil,4 cup flour,1 1/2 teaspoon salt,1/3 cup fresh parmesan cheese , finely grated ,1 teaspoon dry oregano,1 teaspoon dry basil,1 teaspoon dried parsley,3 teaspoon active dry yeast,1 teaspoon sugar,1 tablespoon powdered milk make and share this pizza base for the bread maker recipe from food.com . healthy bread machine min small appliance inexpensive measure all the ingredient into the pan of the bread maker - the order given will give the best result . , run the machine on the dough only cycle . , press down to deflate slightly and rest for 30 minute and heat the oven up with a heavy flat tray or pizza stone on the lowest rack . , spread/stretch/roll out to fit your pizza pan . , top with your favorite topping . , place into your hot oven , still in the pizza pan , on top of the hot tray and bake at 220c for 15-20 minute .
